articles.author: Stephen Culp
articles.description: U.S. stocks ended little changed in holiday-shortened trading on Friday, with low volume and conviction as investors watched the start of the seasonal shopping season for signs of consumer resiliency.
articles.title: Wall St ends mixed in truncated Black Friday trading

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: Lawyers for former Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao are urging a U.S. judge to reject the Justice Department's request to bar him from returning to his home in the United Arab Emirates until he is sentenced for violating anti-money laundering requirements.
articles.title: Ex-Binance CEO Zhao urges judge to allow him leave US before sentencing

articles.author: Gleb Stolyarov, Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Chinese car sales in Russia appear to have peaked as domestic production recovers after the exodus of Western automakers, data shared with Reuters showed, but recent growth in the market may stall as high import costs and interest rates begin to bite.
articles.title: Exclusive: Chinese car sales boom in Russia levels off amid shaky local recovery

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Argentina's President-elect Javier Milei said on Friday that the closure of the country's central bank, a signature campaign pledge, was a "non-negotiable matter", according to a statement from his office posted on social media platform X.
articles.title: Argentina's Milei says shutting central bank 'non-negotiable'

articles.author: Fanny Potkin, Yelin Mo
articles.description: Nvidia (NVDA.O) has told customers in China it is delaying the launch of a new artificial intelligence chip it designed to comply with U.S. export rules until the first quarter of next year, two sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nvidia delays launch of new China-focused AI chip -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's biggest high street bank Lloyds (LLOY.L) is putting around 2,500 jobs at risk as part of a shake-up, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters, amid a renewed push by lenders to slash costs.
articles.title: Britain's Lloyds shake-up puts around 2,500 jobs at risk - source

articles.author: Nia Williams
articles.description: The Canada Energy Regulator (CER) has ordered the company building the Trans Mountain oil pipeline expansion (TMX) to appear at an oral hearing on Monday, as the regulator weighs whether to approve a variance request from the project.
articles.title: Trans Mountain faces regulatory hearing on pipeline variance request

articles.author: Bassam Masoud, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel has received a list of hostages set to be freed from Gaza on Saturday by Palestinian militant group Hamas, officials said, following the release of 24 hostages during the first day of a planned four-day truce on Friday.
articles.title: Israel receives list of hostages to be released Saturday by Hamas

articles.author: Katherine Masters
articles.description: Retailers are hoping forecasts for a cool, dry Black Friday across much of the U.S. will drive millions of shoppers to their stores in the kickoff to the key holiday shopping season.
articles.title: US retailers hope to draw picky Black Friday shoppers to stores

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's military will begin "combat training activities" from Saturday on its side of the border with Myanmar, it said on social media, a day after a convoy of trucks carrying goods into the neighbouring Southeast Asian nation went up in flames.
articles.title: Chinese military holds training drills near Myanmar border after convoy fire
